full_summary:
================================------

**Government Tender Notice**

**Project Title**: Pentaho Maintenance and Support for Platform Services (2022-23)

**Contract Number**: SSC-22-00020428:T

**Publication Date**: October 14, 2022

**Closing Date and Time**: October 27, 2022, 12:00 PM EST

**Type of Tender**: Competitive – Open Bidding

**Description**:

The Shared Services Canada (SSC) is issuing a Request for Proposal (RFP) for software maintenance and support services for its Pentaho platform. The contract duration is from the date of contract signing to November 30, 2024. The contract encompasses multiple components, including support services for the entire scope of the platform.

**Key Requirements**:

* The successful bidder must have at least 5 years of experience with similar services and technical support for the Federal Government of Canada.
* The bid must include a detailed description of how the proposed services will meet the SSC’s technical specifications.
* The successful bidder must provide the necessary licenses, maintenance, and support for the Pentaho platform.

**Areas of Opportunity**:  
This contract will be executed nationally.

**Contracting Agency**: Shared Services Canada  
Address: 90 Metcalfe Street, Room 101, Ottawa, Ontario, Canada K0A 0C3  

**Contact Information**:

* Contact Name: Kyle Hnatyshin  
* Email: [kyle.hnatyshin@ssc-spc.gc.ca](mailto:kyle.hnatyshin@ssc-spc.gc.ca)  
* Phone: (613) 614-1493  
* Fax: (613) 614-1493  
* Address: SSC Kent Street 180 - 180 Kent Street - Ottawa : National Capital Region

**Additional Documents**:  
[Attachment](https://sscp2pspc.ssc-spc.gc.ca/page.aspx/en/fil/download/D575D64A-08D1-43BC-880E-202197DBA109)

Prior to submission, bidders are advised to review the Release and Waiver of liability to be attached to their bid.

The information provided does not prejudice any tender process. SSC retains the discretion to reserve the right to modify or terminate the procurement process at its discretion. 

In the case of inconsistencies, ambiguities, or disputes between the French and English texts, the English text is the only reference point for the texts provided in the RFP.-resolution ought to be regularly sought after by
